alert.note: Alert for Halifax (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 10 at 5:40PM EST until January 12 at 10:36AM EST by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Virginia... Roanoke (Staunton) River at Randolph affecting Halifax and Charlotte Counties. Dan River at Dan River at Paces affecting Halifax County. Dan River at South Boston affecting Halifax County. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Virginia... Roanoke (Staunton) River At Brookneal affecting Halifax, Charlotte and Campbell Counties. For the Roanoke River...including Roanoke, Pigg R Nr Sandy Level, Altavista, Brookneal, Randolph...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Dan River...including Wentworth, STP near Danville, Dan River at Paces, South Boston...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE FRIDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Dan River at Dan River at Paces. * WHEN...Until late Friday morning. * IMPACTS...At 24.0 feet, Low spots along routes 658 and 671 begin to flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 4:45 PM EST Wednesday the stage was 22.1 feet. - Bankfull stage is 18.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 4:45 PM EST Wednesday was 22.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 23.2 feet tomorrow morning. It will then fall below flood stage late tomorrow evening. - Flood stage is 22.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 21.4 feet on 02/17/2021. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Most flood related deaths occur in automobiles. Do not attempt to cross water covered bridges, dips, or low water crossings. Never try to cross a flowing stream, even a small one, on foot. To escape rising water find another route over higher ground. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Thursday morning at 700 AM EST.
